summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous resolutions on the International Tribunal for Rwanda, 

Adopted resolution 1684 (2006) at its 5455th meeting on 13 June 2006.

The resolution recalls the election of 11 judges to a four-year term at the International Tribunal for Rwanda, 
beginning on 25 May 2003 and ending on 24 May 2007.

It also recalls the resignations of judges Mansoor Ahmed, Lloyd George Williams and Asoka Zoysa Gunawardana 
and the subsequent appointments of judges Khalida Rachid Khan, Sir Charles Michael Dennis Byron and Asoka de Silva.

The Security Council decides to extend the term of office of 10 permanent judges at the International Tribunal 
until 31 December 2008, notwithstanding Article 12 bis of the Tribunal's Statute.

The judges whose terms are extended are: 
- Mr. Charles Michael Dennis Byron (Saint Kitts and Nevis)
- Mr. Asoka de Silva (Sri Lanka)
- Mr. Sergei Aleckseievich Egorov (Russian Federation)
- Mr. Mehmet Güney (Turkey)
- Ms. Khalida Rachid Khan (Pakistan)
- Mr. Erik Møse (Norway)
- Ms. Arlete Ramaroson (Madagascar)
- Mr. Jai Ram Reddy (Fiji)
- Mr. William Hussein Sekule (United Republic of Tanzania)
- Ms. Andrésa Vaz (Senegal)
- Ms. Inés Mónica Weinberg de Roca (Argentina)

The Council requests States to ensure their nationals serving as judges remain available until 31 December 2008.
